Open a document.
Create a new document.
Save the document.
Close the document.
Cut the selected content to the Clipboard.
Copy the selected content to the Clipboard.
Paste the contents of the Clipboard.
Select all document content.
Apply bold formatting to text.
Apply italic formatting to text.
Apply underline formatting to text.
Decrease the font size by 1 point.
Increase the font size by 1 point.
Center the text.

Undo the previous action.
Redo the previous action, if possible.
Adjust the zoom magnification.
Split the document window.
Remove the document window split.
Move to the Tell Me or Search field on the Ribbon to search for assistance or Help content.
Open the File page to use Backstage view.
Open the Home tab to use common formatting commands, paragraph styles, and the Find tool.
Open the Insert tab to insert tables, pictures and shapes, headers, or text boxes.
Open the Design tab to use themes, colors, and effects, such as page borders.
Open the Layout tab to work with page margins, page orientation, indentation, and spacing.
Open the References tab to add a table of contents, footnotes, or a table of citations.
Open the Mailings tab to manage Mail Merge tasks and to work with envelopes and labels.
Open the Review tab to use Spell Check, set proofing languages, and to track and review changes to your document.
Open the View tab to choose a document view or mode, such as Read Mode or Outline view. You can also set the zoom magnification and manage multiple document windows.
Select the active tab on the ribbon and activate the access keys.
Show the tooltip for the ribbon element currently in focus.
Open the menu for the selected button.

Move to the submenu when a main menu is open or selected.

Move the cursor one word to the right.

Move the cursor down by one paragraph.

Move the cursor by scrolling the document view down by one screen.

Cycle through floating shapes, such as text boxes or images.
Display the Navigation task pane, to search within the document content.
Display the Go To dialog box, to navigate to a specific page, bookmark, footnote, table, comment, graphic, or other location.
Cycle through the locations of the four previous changes made to the document.
Open the list of browse options to define the type of object to browse by.

Reduce the selection.

Delete one word to the right.

explorer.description: Jump/ focus Address Bar with content selected
Show properties of file or folder
Open context menu of file or folder
Delete an item and place it into the Recycle Bin
Delete an item permanently without placing it into the Recycle Bin
Edit Item. Select name excluding file extension
Jump to next file name to edit (while in editing mode).
Jump to previous file name to edit (while in editing mode).
Change View to Extra Large Icons
Jump/ focus Sort Bar (Content Area Table Header)

XYplorerFree.description: Copy Item full name (ie with path) to clipboard either of all selected items in the List if it got the focus, or of selected Tree item (if focus is on Tree, Catalog, etc
Copy name(s) to clipboard (of all selected items in the List)
Copy path(s) to clipboard (of all selected items in the List)
Copy Compact File Info to clipboard
Opens Batch Rename dialog for selected items in the List

Copy the selected item to current location and automatically renames it with a suffix number. This number will be added before the item's extension (even if it is a folder) unless one was already present, if so it will be incremented.

Copy the selected item to current location and automatically renames it with a suffix based on the current date. This suffix will be added before the item's extension (even if it is a folder). If an item with that name already exist, a suffix number will be automatically added.

Copy the selected item to current location and automatically renames it with a suffix based on the item's last modified date. This suffix will be added before the item's extension (even if it is a folder). If an item with that name already exist, a suffix number will be automatically added.
Copy the selected item on the current location and renames it on-the-fly.

Opens the Preview tab and show the Panel if needed, and starts the preview for the focused item if selected. If there is currently a preview in progress, it will be stopped and the file will be released. Note that if the Panel is visible, the preview tab active, and no files are selected/previewed then Panel will be hidden.
Exit (with or without Saving according to your Configuration)
Deselect All all items currently listed
Select all items of the same type(s) as the selected item(s)
Find Files: Show the panel if hidden and activates the Find Files tab
Find Now: Start File Find operation with the current parameter settings
Filter to only show items with the same extension(s) as the List's selected item(s). If no items are selected, then extension of the focused item is used instead
Filter to hide all items with the same extension as one of the List's selected item(s). If no items are selected, then extension of the focused item is used instead
Grows the Name column by 5 pixels
stractShrinks the Name column by 5 pixels

Instantly desactivate any auto-refreshing for the current location temporarily, without affecting any (Auto-Refresh) settings. The auto-refresh will be reactivated as soon as you change location, or if you manually reactivate it.
Rebuild Tree: rebuilds the whole folder tree and then carries you back to the location where you were before, while closing all other open branches
Refresh File List: update the current list data, but keep any selections and scroll position.
Refresh and Reset File List: update the data, scroll back to top, set focus to the first item (if any), unselect any selections.
Calculate Folder Sizes: calculate selected folder sizes if any, otherwise calculate all folders sizes
Same as the option Show folders in list.
Previous Location: jump to the previous location (useful to zap back and fore between two locations)
Last Target: jump to the most recent target of a move/copy operation that was performed within XY's current session
Go up to the parent folder
Go down to the most recently browsed subfolder of the current location (if any) (see Breadcrumb for more)
Pop up the Breadcrumb menu. Note that Ctrl+Alt+Backspace (and therefore AltGr+Backspace) is also available for this.
Go to...: enter/paste a location to jump to
Go to from Here...: enter/paste a location to jump to (preset to current path)
Go to Line...: enter/paste a line number to jump to
Toggle Favorite Folder: toggle favorite status of current folder
Toggle Highlighted Folder: toggle highlighted status of current folder
Toggle Boxed Branch: toggle boxed branch status of current folder
Opens the Customize Keyboard Shortcuts window
Show Info Panel: toggle the Info Panel's visibility
Contents and Index: display this help file
Show Properties dialog of the focused item (AltGr+Enter to avoid beep sound)
Go to the top folder (Drive, \Server, Desktop, MyDocuments) of the current folder
Delete all currently selected files (Recycle Bin)
Delete all currently selected files (NO Recycle Bin, ie. they are nuked!)
(find results only) jump to currently focused file in its folder
Put the selected item into view, keeping any selection untouched
Abort running operation (eg. creating thumbnails, File Find, Calculate Folder Sizes, ...)
Cycle Tabs Forward, Delay Browsing until all keys are up
Cycle Tabs Backward, Delay Browsing until all keys are up
Move focus among Tree, Address Bar, and List
Open focused web file in new browser window
In lists with shiftable positions: shift selected item up.
In lists with shiftable positions: shift selected item down.
Toggle selected state of focused list item
